verses.textEn: Now therefore, our great God, strong and terrible, who keeps covenant and mercy, may you not avert your face from all the hardship that has found us, we and our kings, and our leaders, and our priests, and our prophets, and our fathers, and all the people, from the days of king Assur, even to this day.
verses.textLa: Nunc itaque Deus noster magne, fortis, et terribilis, custodiens pactum et misericordiam, ne avertas a facie tua omnem laborem, qui invenit nos, reges nostros, et principes nostros, et sacerdotes nostros, et prophetas nostros, et patres nostros, et omnem populum tuum a diebus regis Assur usque in diem hanc.

verses.textEn: For you are just, concerning all things that have overwhelmed us. For you have done truth, but we have acted impiously.
verses.textLa: Et tu iustus es in omnibus, quæ venerunt super nos: quia veritatem fecisti, nos autem impie egimus.

verses.textEn: Our kings, our leaders, our priests, and our fathers have not done your law, and they have not been attentive to your commandments and your testimonies, to which you have testified among them.
verses.textLa: Reges nostri, principes nostri, sacerdotes nostri, et patres nostri non fecerunt legem tuam, et non attenderunt mandata tua, et testimonia tua quæ testificatus es in eis.

verses.textEn: And they have not served you, in their kingdoms and with your many good things, which you gave to them, and in the very wide and fat land, which you delivered into their sight, nor did they return from their most wicked pursuits.
verses.textLa: Et ipsi in regnis suis, et in bonitate tua multa, quam dederas eis, et in terra latissima et pingui, quam tradideras in conspectu eorum, non servierunt tibi, nec reversi sunt a studiis suis pessimis.

verses.textEn: Behold, we ourselves this day are servants. And the land, which you gave to our fathers so that they might eat its bread and have its good things, we ourselves are servants within it.
verses.textLa: Ecce nosipsi hodie servi sumus: et terra, quam dedisti patribus nostris ut comederent panem eius, et quæ bona sunt eius, et nosipsi servi sumus in ea.

verses.textEn: And its fruits are multiplied for the kings, whom you have set over us because of our sins. And they rule over our bodies, and over our cattle, according to their will. And we are in great tribulation.
verses.textLa: Et fruges eius multiplicantur regibus, quos posuisti super nos propter peccata nostra, et corporibus nostris dominantur, et iumentis nostris secundum voluntatem suam, et in tribulatione magna sumus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, concerning all of these things, we ourselves are forming and writing a covenant, and our leaders, our Levites, and our priests are signing it.”
verses.textLa: Super omnibus ergo his nosipsi percutimus fœdus, et scribimus, et signant principes nostri, Levitæ nostri, et Sacerdotes nostri.

verses.textEn: And the signatories were: Nehemiah, the cupbearer, the son of Hacaliah, and Zedekiah,
verses.textLa: Signatores autem fuerunt, Nehemias, Athersatha filius Hachelai, et Sedecias,

verses.textEn: Seraiah, Azariah, Jeremiah,
verses.textLa: Saraias, Azarias, Ieremias,

verses.textEn: Pashhur, Amariah, Malchijah,
verses.textLa: Pheshur, Amarias, Melchias,

verses.textEn: Hattush, Shebaniah, Malluch,
verses.textLa: Hattus, Sebenia, Melluch,

verses.textEn: Harim, Meremoth, Obadiah,
verses.textLa: Harem, Merimuth, Obdias,

verses.textEn: Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch,
verses.textLa: Daniel, Genthon, Baruch,

verses.textEn: Meshullam, Abijah, Mijamin,
verses.textLa: Mosollam, Abia, Miamin,

verses.textEn: Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah; these were the priests.
verses.textLa: Maazia, Belgai, Semeia: hi sacerdotes.

verses.textEn: And the Levites were: Jeshua, the son of Azaniah, Binnui of the sons of Henadad, Kadmiel,
verses.textLa: Porro Levitæ, Iosue filius Azaniæ, Bennui de filiis Henadad, Cedmihel,

verses.textEn: and their brothers, Shebaniah, Hodiah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan,
verses.textLa: et fratres eorum, Sebenia, Odaia, Celita, Phalaia, Hanan,

verses.textEn: Mica, Rehob, Hashabiah,
verses.textLa: Micha, Rohob, Hasebia,

verses.textEn: Zaccur, Sherebiah, Shebaniah,
verses.textLa: Zachur, Serebia, Sabania,

verses.textEn: Hodiah, Bani, Beninu.
verses.textLa: Odaia, Bani, Baninu.

verses.textEn: The heads of the people were: Parosh, Pahath-moab, Elam, Zattu, Bani,
verses.textLa: Capita populi, Pharos, Phahathmoab, Ælam, Zethu, Bani,

verses.textEn: Bunni, Azgad, Bebai,
verses.textLa: Bonni, Azgad, Bebai,

verses.textEn: Adonijah, Bigvai, Adin,
verses.textLa: Adonia, Begoai, Adin,

verses.textEn: Ater, Hezekiah, Azzur,
verses.textLa: Ater, Hezecia, Azur,

verses.textEn: Hodiah, Hashum, Bezai,
verses.textLa: Odaia, Hasum, Besai,

verses.textEn: Hariph, Anathoth, Nebai,
verses.textLa: Hareph, Anathoth, Nebai,

verses.textEn: Magpiash, Meshullam, Hazir,
verses.textLa: Megphias, Mosollam, Hazir,

verses.textEn: Meshezabel, Zadok, Jaddua,
verses.textLa: Mesizabel, Sadoc, Ieddua,

verses.textEn: Pelatiah, Hanan, Anaiah,
verses.textLa: Pheltia, Hanan, Anaia,

verses.textEn: Hoshea, Hananiah, Hasshub,
verses.textLa: Osee, Hanania, Hasub,

verses.textEn: Hallohesh, Pilha, Shobek,
verses.textLa: Alohes, Phalea, Sobec,

verses.textEn: Rehum, Hashabnah, Maaseiah,
verses.textLa: Rehum, Hasebna, Maasia,

verses.textEn: Ahiah, Hanan, Anan,
verses.textLa: Echaia, Hanan, Anan,

verses.textEn: Malluch, Harim, Baanah.
verses.textLa: Melluch, Haran, Baana:

verses.textEn: And the rest of the people were the priests, the Levites, the gatekeepers, and the singers, the temple servants, and all who had separated themselves, from the peoples of the lands, to the law of God, with their wives, their sons, and their daughters.
verses.textLa: et reliqui de populo, Sacerdotes, Levitæ, ianitores, et cantores, Nathinæi, et omnes qui se separaverunt de populis terrarum ad legem Dei, uxores eorum, filii eorum, et filiæ eorum,

verses.textEn: All who were able to understand, pledged on behalf of their brothers, with their nobles, and they came forward to promise and to swear that they would walk in the law of God, which he had given to the hand of Moses, the servant of God, that they would do and keep all the commandments of the Lord our God, and his judgments and his ceremonies,
verses.textLa: omnes qui poterant sapere spondentes pro fratribus suis, optimates eorum, et qui veniebant ad pollicendum, et iurandum ut ambularent in lege Dei, quam dederat in manu Moysi servi Dei, ut facerent et custodirent universa mandata Domini Dei nostri, et iudicia eius et ceremonias eius,

verses.textEn: and that we would not give our daughters to the people of the land, and that we would not accept their daughters for our sons,
verses.textLa: et ut non daremus filias nostras populo terræ, et filias eorum non acciperemus filiis nostris.

verses.textEn: also that, if the people of the land carry in goods for sale or any useful things, so that they might sell them on the day of the Sabbath, that we would not buy them on the Sabbath, nor on a sanctified day, and that we would release the seventh year and the collection of debt from every hand.
verses.textLa: Populi quoque terræ, qui important venalia, et omnia ad usum, per diem Sabbati ut vendant, non accipiemus ab eis in Sabbato et in die sanctificato. Et dimittemus annum septimum, et exactionem universæ manus.

verses.textEn: And we established precepts over ourselves, so that we would give one third part of a shekel each year for the work of the house of our God,
verses.textLa: Et statuemus super nos præcepta, ut demus tertiam partem sicli per annum ad opus domus Dei nostri,

verses.textEn: for the bread of the presence, and for the continual sacrifice, and for a continual holocaust on the Sabbaths, on the new moons, on the solemnities, and for the holy things, and for the sin offering, so that atonement would be made for Israel, and for every use within the house of our God.
verses.textLa: ad panes propositionis, et ad sacrificium sempiternum, et in holocaustum sempiternum in Sabbatis, in calendis, in sollemnitatibus, et in sanctificatis, et pro peccato: ut exoretur pro Israel, et in omnem usum domus Dei nostri.

verses.textEn: Then we cast lots concerning the oblation of the wood among the priests, and the Levites, and the people, so that it would be carried into the house of our God, by the households of our fathers, at set times, from the times of one year to another, so that they might burn upon the altar of the Lord our God, just as it was written in the law of Moses,
verses.textLa: Sortes ergo misimus super oblationem lignorum inter Sacerdotes, et Levitas, et populum, ut inferrentur in domum Dei nostri per domos patrum nostrorum, per tempora, a temporibus anni usque ad annum: ut arderent super altare Domini Dei nostri, sicut scriptum est in lege Moysi:

verses.textEn: and so that we might bring in the first-fruits of our land, and the first-fruits of all the produce from every tree, from year to year, in the house of our Lord,
verses.textLa: et ut afferremus primogenita terræ nostræ, et primitiva universi fructus omnis ligni, ab anno in annum, in domo Domini.

verses.textEn: and the firstborn of our sons, and of our cattle, just as it was written in the law, and the firstborn of our oxen and our sheep, so that they might be offered in the house of our God, to the priests who minister in the house of our God,
verses.textLa: Et primitiva filiorum nostrorum, et pecorum nostrorum, sicut sciptum est in lege, et primitiva boum nostrorum, et ovium nostrarum, ut offerrentur in domo Dei nostri, Sacerdotibus qui ministrant in domo Dei nostri:

verses.textEn: and so that we might bring in the first-fruits of our foods, and of our libations, and the fruits of every tree, also of the vintage and of the oil, to the priests, to the storehouse of our God, with the tithes of our land for the Levites. The Levites also shall receive tithes from our works out of all the cities.
verses.textLa: et primitias ciborum nostrorum, et libaminum nostrorum, et poma omnis ligni, vindemiæ quoque et olei afferemus Sacerdotibus ad gazophylacium Dei nostri, et decimam partem terræ nostræ Levitis. Ipsi Levitæ decimas accipient ex omnibus civitatibus operum nostrorum.

verses.textEn: Now the priest, the son of Aaron, shall be with the Levites in the tithes of the Levites, and the Levites shall offer a tenth part of their tithes in the house of our God, to the storeroom in the house of the treasury.
verses.textLa: Erit autem Sacerdos filius Aaron cum Levitis in decimis Levitarum, et Levitæ offerent decimam partem decimæ suæ in domo Dei nostri, ad gazophylacium in domum thesauri.

verses.textEn: For the sons of Israel and the sons of Levi shall carry to the storehouse the first-fruits of the grain, of the wine, and of the oil. And the sanctified vessels shall be there, and the priests, and the singing men, and the gatekeepers, and the ministers. And we shall not forsake the house of our God.
verses.textLa: Ad gazophylacium enim deportabunt filii Israel, et filii Levi primitias frumenti, vini, et olei: et ibi erunt vasa sanctificata, et Sacerdotes, et cantores, et ianitores, et ministri, et non dimittemus domum Dei nostri.

verses.textEn: Now the leaders of the people lived in Jerusalem. Yet truly, the remainder of the people cast lots, so that they might choose one part in ten who were to live in Jerusalem, the holy city, and nine parts for the other cities.
verses.textLa: Habitaverunt autem principes populi in Ierusalem: reliqua vero plebs misit sortem, ut tollerent unam partem de decem qui habitaturi essent in Ierusalem civitate sancta, novem vero partes in civitatibus.

verses.textEn: Then the people blessed all the men who freely offered themselves to live in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Benedixit autem populus omnibus viris qui se sponte obtulerant ut habitarent in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: And so these are the leaders of the province, who were living in Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah. Now each one lived in his possession, in their cities: Israel, the priests, the Levites, the temple servants, and the sons of the servants of Solomon.
verses.textLa: Hi sunt itaque principes provinciæ qui habitaverunt in Ierusalem, et in civitatibus Iuda. Habitavit autem unusquisque in possessione sua, in urbibus suis, Israel, Sacerdotes, Levitæ, Nathinæi, et filii servorum Salomonis.

verses.textEn: And in Jerusalem, there lived some of the sons of Judah, and some of the sons of Benjamin: of the sons of Judah, Athaiah, the son of Aziam, the son of Zechariah, the son of Amariah, the son of Shephatiah, the son of Mahalalel, of the sons of Perez;
verses.textLa: Et in Ierusalem habitaverunt de filiis Iuda, et de filiis Beniamin: de filiis Iuda, Athaias filius Aziam, filii Zachariæ, filii Amariæ, filii Saphatiæ, filii Malaleel: de filiis Phares,

verses.textEn: Maaseiah, the son of Baruch, the son of Colhozeh, the son of Hazaiah, the son of Adaiah, the son of Joiarib, the son of Zechariah, the son of a Silonite.
verses.textLa: Maasia filius Baruch, filius Cholhoza, filius Hazia, filius Adaia, filius Ioiarib, filius Zachariæ, filius Silonitis:

verses.textEn: All these sons of Perez lived in Jerusalem, four hundred sixty-eight strong men.
verses.textLa: omnes hi filii Phares, qui habitaverunt in Ierusalem, quadringenti sexaginta octo viri fortes.

verses.textEn: Now these are the sons of Benjamin: Sallu, the son of Meshullam, the son of Joed, the son of Pedaiah, the son of Kolaiah, the son of Maaseiah, the son of Ithiel, the son of Jeshaiah;
verses.textLa: Hi sunt autem filii Beniamin: Sellum filius Mosollam, filius Ioed, filius Phadaia, filius Colaia, filius Masia, filius Etheel, filius Isaia,

verses.textEn: and after him Gabbai, Sallai. These were nine hundred twenty-eight.
verses.textLa: et post eum Gebbai, Sellai, nongenti vigintiocto,

verses.textEn: And Joel, the son of Zichri, was their foremost leader. And Judah, the son of Hassenuah, was second over the city.
verses.textLa: et Ioel filius Zechri præpositus eorum, et Iudas filius Senua super civitatem secundus.

verses.textEn: And from the priests, there were Jedaiah, the son of Joiarib, Jachin,
verses.textLa: Et de sacerdotibus, Idaia filius Ioarib, Iachin,

verses.textEn: Seraiah, the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God,
verses.textLa: Saraia filius Helciæ, filius Mosollam, filius Sadoc, filius Meraioth, filius Achitob princeps domus Dei,

verses.textEn: and their brothers, who were doing the works of the temple: eight hundred twenty-two. And Adaiah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Pelaliah, the son of Amzi, the son of Zachariah, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah,
verses.textLa: et fratres eorum facientes opera templi: octingenti vigintiduo. Et Adaia filius Ieroham, filius Phelelia, filius Amsi, filius Zachariæ, filius Pheshur, filius Melchiæ,

verses.textEn: and his brothers, the leaders among the fathers: two hundred forty-two. And Amassai, the son of Azarel, the son of Ahzai, the son of Meshillemoth, the son of Immer,
verses.textLa: et fratres eius principes patrum: ducenti quadragintaduo. Et Amassai filius Azreel, filius Ahazi, filius Mosollamoth, filius Emmer,

verses.textEn: and their brothers, who were very powerful: one hundred twenty-eight. And their foremost leader was Zabdiel, the son of the powerful.
verses.textLa: et fratres eorum potentes nimis: centum vigintiocto, et præpositus eorum Zabdiel filius potentium.

verses.textEn: And from the Levites, there were Shemaiah, the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, the son of Bunni,
verses.textLa: Et de Levitis Semeia filius Hasub, filius Azaricam, filius Hasabia, filius Boni,

verses.textEn: and Shabbethai and Jozabad, who were over all the works which were exterior to the house of God, from among the leaders of the Levites.
verses.textLa: et Sabathai et Iozabed, super omnia opera, quæ erant forinsecus in domo Dei, a principibus Levitarum.

verses.textEn: And Mattaniah, the son of Mica, the son of Zabdi, the son of Asaph, was the leader of praise and confession in prayer, with Bakbukiah, second among his brothers, and Abda, the son of Shammua, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun.
verses.textLa: Et Mathania filius Micha, filius Zebedei, filius Asaph princeps ad laudandum, et ad confitendum in oratione, et Becbecia secundus de fratribus eius, et Abda filius Samua, filius Galal, filius Idithun:

verses.textEn: All the Levites in the holy city were two hundred eighty-four.
verses.textLa: omnes Levitæ in civitate sancta ducenti octoginta quattuor.

verses.textEn: And the gatekeepers, Akkub, Talmon, and their brothers, who guarded the doorways, were one hundred seventy-two.
verses.textLa: Et ianitores, Accub, Telmon, et fratres eorum, qui custodiebant ostia: centum septuaginta duo.

verses.textEn: And the remainder of Israel, the priests and the Levites, were in all the cities of Judah, each one in his own possession.
verses.textLa: Et reliqui ex Israel Sacerdotes et Levitæ in universis civitatibus Iuda, unusquisque in possessione sua.

verses.textEn: And the temple servants were living at Ophel, with Ziha and Gishpa, of the temple servants.
verses.textLa: Et Nathinæi, qui habitabant in Ophel, et Siaha, et Gaspha de Nathinæis.

verses.textEn: And the director of the Levites in Jerusalem was Uzzi, the son of Bani, the son of Hashabiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Mica. The singing men in the ministry of the house of God were from the sons of Asaph.
verses.textLa: Et episcopus Levitarum in Ierusalem, Azzi filius Bani, filius Hasabiæ, filius Mathaniæ, filius Michæ. De filiis Asaph, cantores in ministerio domus Dei.

verses.textEn: In fact, there was a precept of the king about them, and an order among the singing men, throughout each day.
verses.textLa: Præceptum quippe regis super eos erat, et ordo in cantoribus per dies singulos,

verses.textEn: And Pethahiah, the son of Meshezabel, from the sons of Zerah, the son of Judah, was at the hand of the king concerning every word of the people,
verses.textLa: et Phathahia filius Mesezebel, de filiis Zara filii Iuda in manu regis, iuxta omne verbum populi,

verses.textEn: and in the houses throughout all their regions. Some of the sons of Judah lived at Kiriatharba and in its daughter villages, and at Dibon and in its daughter villages, and at Jekabzeel and in its vicinity,
verses.textLa: et in domibus per omnes regiones eorum. De filiis Iuda habitaverunt in Cariatharbe et in filiabus eius: et in Dibon, et in filiabus eius: et in Cabseel, et in viculis eius,

verses.textEn: and at Jeshua, and at Moladah, and at Bethpelet,
verses.textLa: et in Iesue, et in Molada, et in Bethphaleth,

verses.textEn: and at Hazarshual, and at Beersheba and in its daughter villages,
verses.textLa: et in Hasersual, et in Bersabee, et in filiabus eius,

verses.textEn: and at Ziklag, and at Meconah and in its daughter villages,
verses.textLa: et in Siceleg, et in Mochona, et in filiabus eius,

verses.textEn: and at Enrimmon, and at Zorah, and at Jarmuth,
verses.textLa: et in Remmon, et in Saraa, et in Ierimuth,

verses.textEn: Zanoah, Adullam, and in their villages, at Lachish and its regions, and at Azekah and in its daughter villages. And they dwelt from Beersheba as far as the valley of Hinnom.
verses.textLa: Zanoa, Odollam, et in villis earum, Lachis et regionibus eius, et Azeca, et filiabus eius. Et manserunt in Bersabee usque ad vallem Ennom.

verses.textEn: But the sons of Benjamin lived from Geba, at Michmash, and Aija, and Bethel and in its daughter villages,
verses.textLa: Filii autem Beniamin, a Geba, Mechmas, et Hai, et Bethel et filiabus eius:

verses.textEn: to Anathoth, Nob, Ananiah,
verses.textLa: Anathoth, Nob, Anania,

verses.textEn: Hazor, Ramah, Gittaim,
verses.textLa: Asor, Rama, Gethaim,

verses.textEn: Hadid, Zeboim, and Neballat, Lod,
verses.textLa: Hadid, Seboim, et Neballat, Lod

verses.textEn: and Ono, the valley of craftsmen.
verses.textLa: et Ono valle artificum.

verses.textEn: And some of the Levites were apportioned with Judah and Benjamin.
verses.textLa: Et de Levitis portiones Iudæ et Beniamin.

verses.textEn: Now these are the priests and the Levites who ascended with Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,
verses.textLa: Hi sunt autem Sacerdotes et Levitæ, qui ascenderunt cum Zorobabel filio Salathiel, et Iosue: Saraia, Ieremias, Esdras,

verses.textEn: Amariah, Malluch, Hattush,
verses.textLa: Amaria, Melluch, Hattus,

verses.textEn: Shecaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,
verses.textLa: Sebenias, Rheum, Merimuth,

verses.textEn: Iddo, Ginnethon, Abijah,
verses.textLa: Addo, Genthon, Abia,

verses.textEn: Mijamin, Maadiah, Bilgah,
verses.textLa: Miamin, Madia, Belga,

verses.textEn: Shemaiah, and Joiarib, Jedaiah, Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, Jedaiah.
verses.textLa: Semeia, et Ioiarib, Idaia, Sellum, Amoc, Helcias,

verses.textEn: These were the leaders of the priests and of their brothers, in the days of Jeshua.
verses.textLa: Idaia. Isti principes Sacerdotum, et fratres eorum in diebus Iosue.

verses.textEn: And the Levites, Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, Mattaniah, they and their brothers were over the hymns,
verses.textLa: Porro Levitæ, Iesua, Bennui, Cedmihel, Sarebia, Iuda, Mathanias, super hymnos ipsi et fratres eorum:

verses.textEn: with Bakbukiah, as well as Hannai, and their brothers, each one in his office.
verses.textLa: et Becbecia atque Hanni, et fratres eorum unusquisque in officio suo.

verses.textEn: Now Jeshua conceived Joiakim, and Joiakim conceived Eliashib, and Eliashib conceived Joiada,
verses.textLa: Iosue autem genuit Ioacim, et Ioacim genuit Eliasib, et Eliasib genuit Ioiada,

verses.textEn: and Joiada conceived Jonathan, and Jonathan conceived Jaddua.
verses.textLa: et Ioiada genuit Ionathan, et Ionathan genuit Ieddoa.

verses.textEn: And in the days of Joiakim, the priests and the leaders of the families were: of Seraiah, Meraiah; of Jeremiah, Hananiah;
verses.textLa: In diebus autem Ioacim erant Sacerdotes et principes familiarum: Saraiæ, Maraia: Ieremiæ, Hanania:

verses.textEn: of Ezra, Meshullam; of Amariah, Jehohanan;
verses.textLa: Esdræ, Mosollam: Amariæ, Iohanan:

verses.textEn: of Maluchi, Jonathan; of Shebaniah, Joseph;
verses.textLa: Milicho, Ionathan, Sebeniæ, Ioseph:

verses.textEn: of Harim, Adna; of Meraioth, Helkai;
verses.textLa: Haram, Edna: Maraioth, Helci:

verses.textEn: of Adaiah, Zechariah; of Ginnethon, Meshullam;
verses.textLa: Adaiæ, Zacharia, Genthon, Mosollam:

verses.textEn: of Abijah, Zichri; of Mijamin and Moadiah, Piltai;
verses.textLa: Abiæ, Zechri, Miamin et Moadiæ, Phelti:

verses.textEn: of Bilgah, Shammua; of Shemaiah, Jehonathan;
verses.textLa: Belgæ, Sammua: Semaiæ, Ionathan,

verses.textEn: of Joiarib, Mattenai; of Jedaiah, Uzzi;
verses.textLa: Ioiarib, Mathanai: Iodaiæ, Azzi:

verses.textEn: of Sallai, Kallai; of Amok, Eber;
verses.textLa: Sellai, Celai: Amoc, Heber:

verses.textEn: of Hilkiah, Hashabiah; of Jedaiah, Nethanel.
verses.textLa: Helciæ, Hasebia: Idaiæ, Nathanael.

verses.textEn: The Levites, in the days of Eliashib, and Joiada, and Johanan, and Jaddua, and the priests, were written according to the leaders of the families, during the reign of Darius the Persian.
verses.textLa: Levitæ in diebus Eliasib, et Ioiada, et Iohanan, et Ieddoa scripti principes familiarum, et Sacerdotes in regno Darii Persæ.

verses.textEn: The sons of Levi, according to the leaders of the families, were written in the book of the words of those days, even to the days of Johanan, the son of Eliashib.
verses.textLa: Filii Levi principes familiarum, scripti in Libro verborum dierum, et usque ad dies Ionathan, filii Eliasib.

verses.textEn: Now the leaders of the Levites were Hashabiah, Sherebiah, and Jeshua, the son of Kadmiel, and their brothers, in their turns, so that they would praise and confess, according to the precept of David, the man of God. And they served equally and in order.
verses.textLa: Et principes Levitarum, Hasebia, Serebia, et Iosue filius Cedmihel: et fratres eorum per vices suas, ut laudarent et confiterentur iuxta præceptum David viri Dei, et observarent æque per ordinem.

verses.textEn: Mattaniah, and Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, Akkub, were keepers of the gates and of the vestibules before the gates.
verses.textLa: Mathania, et Becbecia, Obedia, Mosollam, Telmon, Accub custodes portarum et vestibulorum ante portas.

verses.textEn: These were in the days of Joiakim, the son of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and in the days of Nehemiah, the governor, and of Ezra, the priest and scribe.
verses.textLa: Hi in diebus Ioacim filii Iosue, filii Iosedec, et in diebus Nehemiæ ducis, et Esdræ sacerdotis scribæque.

verses.textEn: Now at the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, they sought the Levites from all their places, so that they might bring them to Jerusalem, and so that they might keep the dedication, and rejoice with thanksgiving, and with singing, and with cymbals, psalteries, and lyres.
verses.textLa: In dedicatione autem muri Ierusalem requisierunt Levitas de omnibus locis suis ut adducerent eos in Ierusalem, et facerent dedicationem et lætitiam in actione gratiarum, et cantico, et in cymbalis, psalteriis, et citharis.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of the singing men were gathered from the plains surrounding Jerusalem, and from the villages of Netophati,
verses.textLa: Congregati sunt autem filii cantorum de campestribus circa Ierusalem, et de villis Nethuphathi,

verses.textEn: and from the house of Gilgal, and from the regions of Geba and Azmaveth. For the singing men had built villages for themselves around Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: et de domo Galgal, et de regionibus Geba et Azmaveth: quoniam villas ædificaverunt sibi cantores in circuitu Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: And the priests and the Levites were cleansed, and they cleansed the people, and the gates, and the wall.
verses.textLa: Et mundati sunt Sacerdotes et Levitæ, et mundaverunt populum, et portas, et murum.

verses.textEn: Then I caused the leaders of Judah to ascend the wall, and I appointed two great choirs to give praise. And they went to the right upon the wall, toward the dung gate.
verses.textLa: Ascendere autem feci principes Iuda super murum, et statui duos magnos choros laudantium. Et ierunt ad dexteram super murum ad portam sterquilinii.

verses.textEn: And after them went Hoshaiah, and one half part of the leadership of Judah,
verses.textLa: Et ivit post eos Osaias, et media pars principum Iuda,

verses.textEn: and Azariah, Ezra, and Meshullam, Judah, and Benjamin, and Shemaiah, and Jeremiah.
verses.textLa: et Azarias, Esdras, et Mosollam, Iudas, et Beniamin, et Semeia, et Ieremias.

verses.textEn: And some of the sons of the priests went forth with trumpets: Zachariah, the son of Jonathan, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Micaiah, the son of Zaccur, the son of Asaph.
verses.textLa: Et de filiis sacerdotum in tubis, Zacharias filius Ionathan, filius Semeiæ, filius Mathaniæ, filius Michaiæ, filius Zechur, filius Asaph,

verses.textEn: And his brothers, Shemaiah, and Azarel, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethanel, and Judah, and Hanani, went forth with the canticles of David, the man of God. And Ezra, the scribe, was before them at the fountain gate.
verses.textLa: et fratres eius Semeia, et Azareel, Malalai, Galalai, Maai, Nathanael, et Iudas, et Hanani, in vasis cantici David viri Dei: et Esdras scriba ante eos in porta Fontis.

verses.textEn: And opposite them, they ascended by the steps of the city of David, at the ascent of the wall above the house of David, and as far as the water gate to the east.
verses.textLa: Et contra eos ascenderunt in gradibus civitatis David in ascensu muri super domum David, et usque ad portam Aquarum ad Orientem.

verses.textEn: And the second choir of those who gave thanks went forth on the opposite side, and I went after them, and one half part of the people were upon the wall, and upon the tower of the furnaces, as far as the widest wall,
verses.textLa: Et chorus secundus gratias referentium ibat ex adverso, et ego post eum, et media pars populi super murum et super turrim furnorum, et usque ad murum latissimum,

verses.textEn: and above the gate of Ephraim, and above the ancient gate, and above the fish gate, and the tower of Hananel, and the tower of Hamath, and as far as the flock gate. And they stood still at the watch gate.
verses.textLa: et super portam Ephraim, et super portam antiquam, et super portam piscium et turrim Hananeel, et turrim Emath, et usque ad portam gregis: et steterunt in porta custodiæ,

verses.textEn: And the two choirs of those who gave praise stood still at the house of God, with myself and one half part of the magistrates who were with me.
verses.textLa: steteruntque duo chori laudantium in domo Dei, et ego, et dimidia pars magistratuum mecum.

verses.textEn: And the priests, Eliakim, Maaseiah, Mijamin, Micaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah, Hananiah, went forth with trumpets,
verses.textLa: Et Sacerdotes, Eliachim, Maasia, Miamin, Michea, Elioenai, Zacharia, Hanania in tubis,

verses.textEn: with Maaseiah, and Shemaiah, and Eleazar, and Uzzi, and Jehohanan, and Malchijah, and Elam, and Ezer. And the singers were singing clearly, and Jezrahiah was their foremost leader.
verses.textLa: et Maasia, et Semeia, et Eleazar, et Azzi, et Iohanan, et Melchia, et Ælam, et Ezer. Et clare cecinerunt cantores, et Iezraia præpositus:

verses.textEn: And on that day, they immolated great sacrifices, and they rejoiced. For God had caused them to rejoice with great joy. And their wives and children also were glad. And the rejoicing of Jerusalem was heard from far away.
verses.textLa: et immolaverunt in die illa victimas magnas, et lætati sunt: Deus enim lætificaverat eos lætitia magna: sed et uxores eorum et liberi gavisi sunt, et audita est lætitia Ierusalem procul.

verses.textEn: On that day also, they enrolled men over the storehouses of the treasury, for the libations, and for the first-fruits, and for the tithes, so that the leaders of the city might bring these in, by them, with proper thanksgiving, for the priests and the Levites. For Judah was rejoicing in the priests and the Levites who were assisting.
verses.textLa: Recensuerunt quoque in die illa viros super gazophylacia thesauri ad libamina, et ad primitias, et ad decimas, ut introferrent per eos principes civitatis in decore gratiarum actionis, Sacerdotes et Levitas: quia lætificatus est Iuda in Sacerdotibus et Levitis astantibus.

verses.textEn: And they kept the vigil of their God, and the vigil of expiation, with the singing men and the gatekeepers, in accord with the precept of David, and of Solomon, his son.
verses.textLa: Et custodierunt observationem Dei sui, et observationem expiationis, et cantores, et ianitores iuxta præceptum David, et Salomonis filii eius,

verses.textEn: For in the days of David and Asaph, from the beginning, there were leaders appointed over the singers, to give praise in verses, and to confess to God.
verses.textLa: quia in diebus David et Asaph ab exordio erant principes constituti cantorum in carmine laudantium, et confitentium Deo.

verses.textEn: And all of Israel, in the days of Zerubbabel, and in the days of Nehemiah, gave portions to the singing men and to the gatekeepers, for each day, and they sanctified the Levites, and the Levites sanctified the sons of Aaron.
verses.textLa: Et omnis Israel, in diebus Zorobabel, et in diebus Nehemiæ dabant partes cantoribus et ianitoribus per dies singulos, et sanctificabant Levitas, et Levitæ sanctificabant filios Aaron.

verses.textEn: Now on that day, they read from the book of Moses in the hearing of the people. And in it, there was found written that the Ammonites and the Moabites must not enter the church of God, even for all time,
verses.textLa: In die autem illo lectum est in volumine Moysi audiente populo: et inventum est scriptum in eo, quod non debeant introire Ammonites et Moabites in ecclesiam Dei usque in æternum:

verses.textEn: because they did not meet the sons of Israel with bread and water, and they hired Balaam against them, to curse them. But our God turned the curse into a blessing.
verses.textLa: eo quod non occurrerint filiis Israel cum pane et aqua: et conduxerint adversum eos Balaam, ad maledicendum eis: et convertit Deus noster maledictionem in benedictionem.

verses.textEn: Now it happened that, when they had heard the law, they separated every foreigner from Israel.
verses.textLa: Factum est autem, cum audissent legem, separaverunt omnem alienigenam ab Israel.

verses.textEn: And Eliashib, the priest, was over this task; he had been given charge of the treasury of the house of our God, and he was a close relative of Tobiah.
verses.textLa: Et super hoc erat Eliasib sacerdos, qui fuerat præpositus in gazophylacio domus Dei nostri, et proximus Tobiæ.

verses.textEn: Then he made for himself a large storeroom, and in that place, there was laid before him gifts, and frankincense, and vessels, and the tithes of grain, wine, and oil, the portions of the Levites, and of the singing men, and of the gatekeepers, and the first-fruits of the priests.
verses.textLa: Fecit ergo sibi gazophylacium grande, et ibi erant ante eum reponentes munera, et thus, et vasa, et decimam frumenti, vini, et olei, partes Levitarum, et cantorum, et ianitorum, et primitias sacerdotales.

verses.textEn: But during all this, I was not in Jerusalem, because in the thirty-second year of Artaxerxes, the king of Babylon, I went to the king, and at the end of some days, I petitioned the king.
verses.textLa: In omnibus autem his non fui in Ierusalem, quia anno trigesimo secundo Artaxerxis regis Babylonis veni ad regem, et in fine dierum rogavi regem.

verses.textEn: And I went to Jerusalem, and I understood the evil that Eliashib had done for Tobiah, such that he would make him a storeroom in the vestibules of the house of God.
verses.textLa: Et veni in Ierusalem, et intellexi malum, quod fecerat Eliasib Tobiæ ut faceret ei thesaurum in vestibulis domus Dei.

verses.textEn: And it seemed to me very evil. And I cast the vessels of the house of Tobiah outside of the storeroom.
verses.textLa: Et malum mihi visum est valde. Et proieci vasa domus Tobiæ foras de gazophylacio:

verses.textEn: And I gave instructions, and they cleansed again the storeroom. And I brought back, into that place, the vessels of the house of God, the sacrifice, and the frankincense.
verses.textLa: præcepique et emundaverunt gazophylacia: et retuli ibi vasa domus Dei, sacrificium, et thus.

verses.textEn: And I realized that the portions of the Levites had not been given to them, and that each one had fled into his own region, from the Levites, and from the singing men, and from those who were ministering.
verses.textLa: Et cognovi quod partes Levitarum non fuissent datæ: et fugisset unusquisque in regionem suam de Levitis, et cantoribus, et de his, qui ministrabant:

verses.textEn: And I brought the case before the magistrates, and I said, “Why have we forsaken the house of God?” And I gathered them together, and I caused them to stand at their stations.
verses.textLa: et egi causam adversus magistratus, et dixi: Quare dereliquimus domum Dei? Et congregavi eos, et feci stare in stationibus suis.

verses.textEn: And all of Judah brought the tithes of the grain, and the wine, and the oil into the storehouses.
verses.textLa: Et omnis Iuda apportabat decimam frumenti, vini, et olei in horrea.

verses.textEn: And we appointed over the storehouses, Shelemiah, the priest, and Zadok, the scribe, and Pedaiah from the Levites, and next to them Hanan, the son of Zaccur, the son of Mattaniah. For they had proven to be faithful. And so the portions of their brothers were entrusted to them.
verses.textLa: Et constituimus super horrea Selemiam Sacerdotem, et Sadoc scribam, et Phadaiam de Levitis, et iuxta eos Hanan filium Zachur, filium Mathaniæ: quoniam fideles comprobati sunt, et ipsis creditæ sunt partes fratrum suorum.

verses.textEn: Remember me, O my God, because of this, and may you not wipe away my acts of compassion, which I have done for the house of my God and for his ceremonies.
verses.textLa: Memento mei Deus meus pro hoc, et ne deleas miserationes meas, quas feci in domo Dei mei, et in ceremoniis eius.

verses.textEn: In those days, I saw, in Judah, some who were treading the presses on the Sabbath, and who were carrying sheaves, and placing on donkeys burdens of wine, and of grapes, and of figs, and all manner of burdens, and who were bringing these into Jerusalem on the day of the Sabbath. And I contended with them, so that they would sell on a day when it was permitted to sell.
verses.textLa: In diebus illis vidi in Iuda calcantes torcularia in Sabbato, portantes acervos, et onerantes super asinos vinum, et uvas, et ficus, et omne onus, et inferentes in Ierusalem die Sabbati. Et contestatus sum ut in die qua vendere liceret, venderent.

verses.textEn: And some Tyrians dwelt within, who were bringing fish and all kinds of items for sale. And they were selling on the Sabbaths to the sons of Judah in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Et Tyrii habitaverunt in ea inferentes pisces, et omnia venalia: et vendebant in Sabbatis filiis Iuda in Ierusalem:

verses.textEn: And I put the nobles of Judah under oath, and I said to them: “What is this evil thing that you are doing, profaning the Sabbath day?
verses.textLa: et obiurgavi optimates Iuda, et dixi eis: Quæ est hæc res mala, quam vos facitis et profanatis diem Sabbati?

verses.textEn: Did not our fathers do these things, and so our God brought all this evil upon us and upon this city? And you are adding more wrath upon Israel by violating the Sabbath!”
verses.textLa: Numquid non hæc fecerunt patres nostri, et adduxit Deus noster super nos omne malum hoc, et super civitatem hanc? Et vos additis iracundiam super Israel violando Sabbatum.

verses.textEn: And it happened that, when the gates of Jerusalem had rested on the day of the Sabbath, I spoke, and they closed the gates. And I instructed that they should not open them until after the Sabbath. And I appointed some of my servants over the gates, so that no one would carry in a burden on the day of the Sabbath.
verses.textLa: Factum est autem, cum quievissent portæ Ierusalem in die Sabbati, dixi: et clauserunt ianuas, et præcepi ut non aperirent eas usque post Sabbatum: et de pueris meis constitui super portas, ut nullus inferret onus in die Sabbati.

verses.textEn: And so the merchants and those who sold all kinds of items remained just outside of Jerusalem, once and again.
verses.textLa: Et manserunt negotiatores, et vendentes universa venalia foris Ierusalem semel et bis.

verses.textEn: And I contended with them, and I said to them: “Why are you remaining just beyond the wall? If you do this again, I will send hands upon you.” And so, from that time, they no longer came on the Sabbath.
verses.textLa: Et contestatus sum eos, et dixi eis: Quare manetis ex adverso muri? Si secundo hoc feceritis, manum mittam in vos. Itaque ex tempore illo non venerunt in Sabbato.

verses.textEn: I also spoke to the Levites, so that they would be cleansed, and would arrive to guard the gates and to sanctify the day of the Sabbath. Because of this also, O my God, remember me and spare me, in accord with the multitude of your mercies.
verses.textLa: Dixi quoque Levitis ut mundarentur, et venirent ad custodiendas portas, et sanctificandam diem Sabbati: et pro hoc ergo memento mei Deus meus, et parce mihi secundum multitudinem miserationum tuarum.

verses.textEn: But also in those days, I saw some Jews taking wives from the Ashdodites, and the Ammonites, and the Moabites.
verses.textLa: Sed et in diebus illis vidi Iudæos ducentes uxores Azotidas, Ammonitidas, et Moabitidas.

verses.textEn: And their sons spoke partly in the speech of Ashdod, and they did not know how to speak the Jewish language, and they were speaking according to the language of one people or another.
verses.textLa: Et filii eorum ex media parte loquebantur Azotice, et nesciebant loqui Iudaice, et loquebantur iuxta linguam populi, et populi.

verses.textEn: And I put them under oath, and I cursed them. And I struck some of their men, and I shaved off their hair, and I made them swear to God that they would not give their daughters to their sons, nor take their daughters for their sons, nor for themselves, saying:
verses.textLa: Et obiurgavi eos, et maledixi. Et cecidi ex eis viros, et decalvavi eos, et adiuravi in Deo, ut non darent filias suas filiis eorum, et non acciperent de filiabus eorum filiis suis, et sibimetipsis, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Did not Solomon, king of Israel, sin in this kind of thing? And certainly, among many nations, there was no king similar to him, and he was beloved of his God, and God set him as king over all of Israel. And yet foreign women led even him into sin!
verses.textLa: Numquid non in huiuscemodi re peccavit Salomon rex Israel? Et certe in gentibus multis non erat rex similis ei, et dilectus Deo suo erat, et posuit eum Deus regem super omnem Israel: et ipsum ergo duxerunt ad peccatum mulieres alienigenæ.

verses.textEn: So how could we disobey and do all this great evil, so that we would transgress against our God, and take foreign wives?”
verses.textLa: Numquid et nos inobedientes faciemus omne malum grande hoc ut prævaricemur in Deo nostro, et ducamus uxores peregrinas?

verses.textEn: Now one of the sons of Joiada, the son of Eliashib, the high priest, was a son-in-law to Sanballat, a Horonite, and I made him flee from me.
verses.textLa: De filiis autem Ioiada filii Eliasib sacerdotis magni, gener erat Sanaballat Horonites, quem fugavi a me.

verses.textEn: O Lord, my God, remember against those who defile the priesthood and the law of the priests and the Levites!
verses.textLa: Recordare Domine Deus meus adversum eos, qui polluunt sacerdotium, iusque Sacerdotale et Leviticum.

verses.textEn: And so I cleansed them from all foreigners, and I established the orders of the priests and the Levites, each one in his ministry.
verses.textLa: Igitur mundavi eos ab omnibus alienigenis, et constitui ordines Sacerdotum et Levitarum, unumquemque in ministerio suo:

verses.textEn: O my God, remember me also, for good, because of the offering of wood, at the appointed times, and because of the first-fruits. Amen.
verses.textLa: et in oblatione lignorum in temporibus constitutis, et in primitivis: memento mei Deus meus in bonum. Amen.
